Use asparagus, brussels sprouts, onions—whatever vegetables you're craving. This recipe is part of the 2019 Feel Good Food Plan, our ten-day plan for starting the year off right.Ingredients8 servings1bunch carrots, cut into thick rounds1head of cauliflower or broccoli, separated into florets3Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oilKosher salt4–6sweet potatoes, scrubbedPreparationPlace racks in upper and lower thirds of oven; preheat to 425°. Toss carrots, cauliflower, and oil on a large rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and toss again. Place sweet potatoes on a small foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Roast veggies, tossing once, until browned and tender, 25–30 minutes for carrots and cauliflower and 35–40 minutes for potatoes.How would you rate Meal-Prep Roasted Vegetables?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTrianglePerfect!
